inn1.comm: outside off, a bit of nibble off the seam from a good length, Roy half-plays, half-leaves
solidly forward on the front foot, deflected to square leg
beautiful strike, Roy strides out to meet a wide half-volley, maybe slides as he does so, but strikes it so cleanly, all along the ground through the covers
full face of the bat once again, less intent this time as mid-off tidies up
tighter line, worked to the leg side with another straight-batted push
lifting off the deck, good carry as Roy raises his gloves out of harm's way
angled bat, deflected down to third man
hint of width, through to the keeper
ooh, a bit of swing from a very full length, met with an aggressive push and inside-edged onto the boot
forward and driven through the covers, beautiful strike
forward and they scamper hard for an apparent fumble in the covers, but my goodness that would have been tight. Vince was late setting off but just about made it
deflected off the pad
banging out a good length, outside off stump
flipped off the hip, into the leg side
full length, met with soft hands and a gentle deflection out into the cordon. Well angled blade and a stolen single from an otherwise fine delivery
swinging into the pads, deflected behind square
tapped into the covers
forward and defended to cover
tight line on off stump from the awkward left-armer's line. Defended on the back foot
a touch of width, drilled to mid-off
on the pads, looking for swing but not finding it
spanking shot, width and full length, begging to be drilled off the front foot through the covers
very full, hint of lateral movement but Vince's clip through midwicket just about beats a sprawling dive
that is glorious. All knees and elbows, bending into the ball then springing it through the covers as if flicking a latch. Power and placement
tight line, defended to cover
down the track to meet the pitch, then flicked off the toes through backward square
onto the front foot, blocked into the covers
back of a length, dabbed down at the feet off the back foot, and another excellent stolen single. England are suddenly so good at rotating the strike
tucked to short midwicket
down the leg side, but not far enough to be called wide, must have flicked a buckle or something
a hint of swing from wide outside off, a good leave
tighter line, angled into the pads, worked into the leg side
poked into the covers, stunning alert fielding at point turns an easy single into a frantic scramble - pounced on with one hand, sprang to the feet, but missed at the non-striker's end by a whisker!
straight-batted defence into the leg side
short and panned into the leg side
back of a length, jabbed into the off side, another well-stolen single
outside off, just back of a length, clubbed to point
defended off the back foot
too wide, and chased with a deliberate flashy steer through the yawning gaps in the cordon. Bandara has changed ends to no avail just yet...
tighter line, pushed into the covers off the back foot
defended down the ground
up onto the toes, pushed into the covers. A good recovery after that flashy four
half an appeal but a big suspicion of inside-edge. Tight line though
up onto the toes, deflected down through the cordon to swipe another single. Great release shot
fuller length, another attempted nurdle through third man but couldn't get it fine enough this time
width initially, but nipped back in as Vince lined up an expansive back-foot wallop. Defended in the end with one hand off the bat
open face, glided through third man again
eased into the leg side, another pinched single to keep the strike
on the pads, deflected fine, misdirected and seized upon
poked into the leg side, more easy runs
and there's four more! Another full-blooded golf-swing, clean as you like over long-on
back of a length, turned to the leg side to rotate the strike
down the track, looking for the big stroke but settling for the angled punch through point
short of a length, pulled off a bit of splice, but finds the gap at deep midwicket and there's a long chase for the fielders. Runs are rattling now
full length, angling in, pushed into the covers
full length, worked back past the non-striker
good delivery, attacking the pitch and lifting into a back-foot defence on off stump
short and slammed out through midwicket, tidied up by the sweeper
too short, and slammed behind square on the pull, slightly top-edged but lands well short of the fielder
clipped firmly into space at deep mid-wicket, a good sprawling dive cuts off the boundary
pulled fiercely, just out of the reach of the diving Prasanna at short midwicket
extra nip off the turf, and Roy whips his bottom hand off the bat in surprise
fended out through square leg, back of a length
back of a length, nipping back into the right-hander, who opens the face to glide another brace to third man
nips off the seam. Lovely bowling, beats the inside edge as the keeper tidies up
strays onto the pads, flicked into the gap
full length, defended
driven firmly, through the gap between cover and mid-off. Well placed

big, ambitious wipe across the line, and Roy's fierce strike is held up in the cross-wind for Perera at deep midwicket to steady himself under the fast-plummeting orb and pouch it with a dive. Well judged, and England's power-player is gone!
full length, and blocked into the toes
angled into the gap, pinching the singles well
that's just immaculate. First ball, who needs a sighter? Just leaning into the stroke, it's in his zone, and he places it perfectly through the covers with a high elbow. Shot
drop and go ... that dropped so close to the feet that Vince had to pause for a split-second to make sure the ball didn't roll into his stumps. But Root was onto it, calling him through regardless
short, and pulled away, not entirely timed but placed well enough
on the drive again, and a flappy piece of fielding at extra cover gifts the boundary. He slid well, then missed with his paw at the ball, like a cat chasing a laser-beam
tapped into the covers again
very full, jammed back to the bowler, who feigns a shy in his followthrough
very full, strikes the pads but sliding down
tighter line, attacking off stump, met with a full face in defence
pushed into the covers again
another sumptuous full-faced push down the ground, in the air for a while but out of the reach of the bowler, and too straight for long-off to intercept
tighter line again, compact defence
width, and jabbed to backward point
short and pulled round the corner into the gap behind square
round the wicket, deflected to square leg
full length, driven out of the toes, through wide mid-on
swept fine, a long chase for backward square and a comfortable couple
tossed and driven down to long on
ooh, tight line and almost trapped on the back foot, just enough outside edge to save the lbw
another big dive on the third man boundary but can't cut that off
floated up on off, pushed back to the bowler
full, non-turning ball outside off, he eases forward and drives through the covers
quicker and pushed outside off, driven to long-off
Root steps forward to smother any spin
flighted and outside off, Root leans forward and caresses through the covers
skids through at off stump, Vince defensively bunts it back to the bowler
straight in line, blocked back to the bowler
leg-stump ball, flicked out to square leg
pushed on middle from round the stumps, Root targets the leg side and skews a leading edge. Rolls through the covers
Danuska pulls his length back slightly, allowing Root to skip back and whip it to deep midwicket
the  batsman uses his feet, Danushka pushes it shorter. Check-dabbed back to the bowler
much slower through the air, sticks in the surface, Vince is through with the leg-side flick. He ends up popping it in front of square leg
full and outside off, crisp drive to deep cover ensues
Vince makes room and plays an inside-out drive to long-off to bring up the team's 100
fired into the pads, glanced to fine leg
drifts in full, takes the inside edge of the wafting bat and runs to short fine leg
slides on just a shade outside off, chopped to deep point on the back foot for a couple

Vince scores a half-century in his maiden ODI innings. He did not bat on ODI debut. Darted onto the leg stump at 85ks, knocked towards short fine leg. They push on for a quick single. Vince slides his bat in. Well played
picked away off the pads to deep backward square leg
pushed into the covers
down the track and worked to midwicket, where the fielder throws himself to his left and takes some pace off the ball

the angle from round the wicket does the trick. Slides on with the arm outside off, Danushka shortened his length slightly on seeing the batsman skip out of the crease. Vince slashes and only connects with thin air. Lolly-pop stumping for Chandi
floated on off, forward and nudged towards point
slides on off, Morgan steps back and punches to short cover
full and drifts in on off, pokey drive off the inside edge to cover
full on off, tapped down to long-off
pushed on off, Morgan stays back and plays a whippy drive to long-on

chipped in the air.... Mathews at short extra cover reacted late, thinking it was the bowler's catch. He dives into the soil, the ball drops in front of him. Mathews and the bowler throw glances at each other. Prasanna induced the leading edge from a lazy leg-side flick, but did not attempt the catch. In the end, it got too difficult for Mathews
clipped to the leg side as this was full and straight
lobs a full toss, which is milked down the ground for one
pushed to the right of the bowler, he dives and takes some pace
cramps Morgan for room, played back
tossed and outside off, Morgan pre-meditates a paddle fine on the leg side. He ends up edging it between Mathews at slip and Chandi
full and outside off, cracked to short extra cover, where the fielder fumbles, and allows one
Root feigned to step out. This is banged short. He stays in the crease and pulls to deep square leg
flat cramping ball, Morgan can only block it back to the bowler
slider on middle, camps back and punches a single down to long-on
a big appeal for lbw, umpire Gough shakes his head. Tossed full, pitched maybe outside leg, Morgan seeks to reverse-sweep. Might have gloved it as well. Mathews wasn't interested in a review
full on middle, run back to the bowler
Morgan jumps down the track and swipes to long-on
another skiddy full one, attacking the stumps, defended back to the boiwer
legbreak outside off, chopped out to point
Morgan connects well and finds four now! He takes it outside off and reverse sweeps past slip. Fast hands...
floated on middle, Morgan presses forward and bunts to short extra cover
Morgan steps away outside leg and hits an inside-out drive over the covers. Good manipulation
flat and straight, dabbed quietly to the leg side off the back foot
full on middle again, clipped to midwicket, coming forward
nurdled off the pads to the square leg region for one
full toss on off, whipped smartly to wide long-on
drifting outside leg, picked away through backward square leg
tossed on middle, straight-bat push to long-on
slid on middle, Morgan stepped out and check-drove back to the bowler
Morgan runs down the track like a raging elephant and exploits the short boundary. He meets the pitch and slugs it over long-on for six; first of the day. It was tossed slow and outside off
short on off, Morgan keeps back and whips to long-on. England keep ticking
speared down the leg side, wide

Morgan tosses away another bright start. Looped up outside off, Morgan seeks to drive it inside-out. He ends up slicing it in the air. Mendis at sweeper cover runs to his left and completes a smart tumbling catch. Plucked it inches from the ground
full and angled across off, driven to sweeper cover
shortish and outside off, hangs back and forces to short extra cover
slid through on middle and leg, Bairstow goes back and defends to the leg side
pushed at the base of off, pushed back to the bowler
shorter and outside off, Bairstow drops back and punches to mid-off
Prasanna lobs a full toss, and it's laced through the covers

Bairstow dishes out a dive at the non-striker's end, even as Chandi swoops on the ball and pings a direct hit. TV umpire called in. The bat is on the ground, no issues for Bairstow and England. Excellent full-stretch dive. Leg-stump ball, deflected square off the pad
stabbed towards backward point off the face
back of a length on middle, turned to the midwicket region off the back foot
slides on the leg stump, tickled to short fine leg
floated on middle, flowy drive to short extra cover, where the fielder, Mathews I think, dives to his right and only makes a half-save
flat on middle and leg, Bairstow sits back and flicks to square leg
drifting outside leg, Bairstow bends low, and paddles a couple to long leg
fired on middle, no turn, drilled drive wide of mid-off
pushed on the off stump, defended back to the bowler
tucked off the pads to deep midwicket. A fumble in the deep, sloppy stuff from Danushka. England steal a second
another straighter one, this is pushed back to Mendis
tossed on middle and leg, smoothly pushed down to long-on
full on middle, eased to wide long-on
flat on middle, forward and slapped to short extra cover
slow and straight, flipped to short midwicket. Tight lines
full and straight again, worked through square leg
lobbed on middle, bunted to the right of the bowler
full and angled across off, driven to mid-off, at the edge of the ring
dinky stuff from Root. Tossed on middle, no turn, Root goes low and reverse-paddles it fine of short third man for four
zipped through outside off, past the prodding bat
floated around off, reverse-swept to short third man
nails a yorker on middle, jabbed to square leg
full toss on middle, heaved to deep midwicket
floated on off, driven crisply to short extra cover
the batsman leans back and glides this one through point
Bairstow aims to open up the off side and steps outside leg. This drifts in and takes the inside edge as the ball rolls to mid-on
tossed full on middle, knocked down the ground
belted fiercely! Bairstow dashes down the track and drills it away past the bowler to the long-off boundary, even as he got too close to the pitch
down the track again, check-pushed past Prasanna now. Not much violence, here
pushed on middle and leg, tucked out to short midwicket
pitched outside leg and drifting down, swept firmly to deep square leg
looped on off, driven to mid-off
floated on middle, reverse-dabbed to short third man
skiddy one of the off stump, cramping ball, as the batsman makes room and carves to mid-off
dropped short on middle, Root steps back, rolls his wrists, and pulls to deep midwicket
good length ball on off, pushed down to long-off for one
width outside off, flayed to sweeper cover, another misfield in the deep, this does not cost SL
Root dances out and makes room. He yorks himself and is beaten outside off
Bandara errs in length, serves a full toss outside off, driven firmly, short extra cover throws himself to his left and half-stops the ball. A slight mix-up and England manage only one
back of a length and outside off, tapped to long-off
short and outside off, Root stands tall and punches it sweetly to deep backward point
full on middle, clipped to wide long-on
YJB crouches and whips this leg-stump ball to deep square leg
down the pitch and Root flicks through midwicket for a typically busy half-century. He acknowledges the applause
turned to midwicket

YJB holes out to long-on! He was perhaps caught between attacking and dinking on this occasion. Tossed on middle from round the wicket, YJB stepped away outside leg to open up the off side. Instead of bashing that away with an inside-out hit, he halfheartedly shovels a catch to Shanaka
full on off, whipped to short midwicket, who deflects to wide long-on
full and Bandara attacks the stumps for a change, blocked back off the back foot
floats an overpitched ball outside off, driven straight ti short extra cover
full and angled across off, this is driven to sweeper cover
errant ball on the hips, leg-stump line, tickled away to the fine-leg boundary off an inside edge
short and angling away outside off, kicks up at the batsman. He does well. Rises on top of the bounce and fends it towards point
Buttler takes a couple of paces forward, Bandara drags his length back on off. Gently defended to the covers
slides on middle, flipped through square leg off the back foot
heading down leg, tickled to short fine leg, Tharanga dives and fumbles
full and straight, whipped through midwicket
full on middle, played back to the bowler
slides on off, whipped off the back foot through midwicket
floated down leg, picked away through square leg for one
tight line, blocked into the covers
on the pads, whisked through square leg to resume the run-making
that's a lovely stroke, punched off the back foot with power and timing. Tidied up in the deep but you could feel the clarity on that shot
slightly more expansive, very full length, inside-edged into the crease
blocked down to long-on
very full, poked back to the bowler
worked into the leg side
tapped into the gap at midwicket and they push for two. The 200 is up
on the pads, attempted fine glance, but short backward square is hovering
worked off the pads again, good restrictive line
forward and pushed back to the bowler, who seems to jar his elbow as he dives to field. He'll live, it's still attached
that's a good over, worked to leg once more, and that's the end of a fine constraining spell
tight line, back of a length, an open-faced glide down to third man
crunched out to deep cover
punched into the covers
open face once again, driven hard to deep point. England still content to work the singles for the moment
thrashed down the ground, another single to long-off
way outside off and swinging wider, England will have that one again
width, walloped. Big stride, full-blooded bendy-kneed biff through the covers. A tight over suddenly turns leaky at the death
blotted into the covers
tossed up, ended up as a low full-toss by the time a stretching slog-sweep reached it. Not quite timed out to deep midwicket
round the wicket, lots of air, pushed to cover
singles, singles everywhere, tucked to leg this time
full length, looped above the eyeline, no temptation for the big shot just yet as this one is pushed into the covers
misdirected. Another extra
good riposte, very full and straight, defended on the back foot
tight line, worked to short midwicket
fizzed down the leg-side, a few too many extras sneaking into Sri Lanka's bowling effort
very full, punched to long-on
up on the toes, tapped to short cover for another single
fuller length, smeared across the line, out to square leg. Another single...
short, helped round the corner but backward square is well placed
punched off the back foot to cover
heaved across the line, there's one of those singles
good delivery, lifting outside off and through to the keeper, past a wafting bat
drilled back towards the bowler, half-stopped but they run for the deflection
big appeal and Sri Lanka are reviewing. Struck him flush on the pad, no hint of inside-edge but it was missing leg
worked to leg
pushed into the covers. The spinners are playing a key role in limiting England's aggression
very full, almost a yorker, respectfully blocked into the off side
well beaten, as Root advanced and Lakmal responded with a slower ball, banged in short and beating a wild swing across the line
very well bowled again, yorker length, well dug out into the leg side, but they still steal the single
thwacked. That was all about the bottom hand, nothing desperately wrong with the ball, a full length, challenging the big shot, but Buttler got his front leg clear and tonked it through the covers
full again, blocked into the leg side
width, and smacked down to deep backward point
scooper dooper! Round he goes, flipping his stance, waiting for the length ball to rise into his inverted blade, and tinked over the top of the keeper

stays on the leg-side, taps a well-timed cut through backward point, and an excellent chase to the rope by Bandara is utterly ruined by a hopeless attempt at a drag-back that he lops over his own head!
punched into the covers
attempted reverse dab, but Pradeep takes off all of the pace and the ball bobbles past the bat to the keeper
same shot, same result! Root can't connect with Pradeep's wiles, Third man is up so there are runs on offer if he beats the fielder
deary me, he's only gone for it again, and missed it again! He was chortling at Alastair Cook's ramp shot during the Lord's Test but that was all a bit uncharacteristically village ...
wow. Stunning power from an almost non-existent backlift. Meets a full length with oodles of bottom hand and that vanishes over wide long-off
worked into the leg side
short, and pulled through deep square leg
worked into the leg side, long chase and back they come
up onto the toes, crunched out to deep cover, and up comes Buttler's fifty from 35 balls, and he hasn't yet broken sweat
flipped round the corner, they target the second run straightaway, but this is going to be tight as Root dives for the crease ... no it's not, he's miles in.
pushed back into the crease, defended to the off side
low full toss, sweetly timed into the leg side
back of a length, and a mistimed pull dribbles with such perfect lack of power that they can pick off an easy two to a deep-set field
width, slapped to point, who thinks about the shy but the running is too sharp
shuffling at the crease, punched to cover
held back and pulled firmly out to deep midwicket
open face, glided out to a diving point
a misdirected long-hop and this one is helped behind square with an under-edged pull. No cutting that off
round the wicket and defended into the covers, working the change of angle
slammed on the up and over the covers. That's better from Root, but Bandara is under the cosh now
pummelled back down the track and worn on the ankle. That will hurt
good finish to the over, speared into the stumps from round the wicket
slower ball, helped into the leg-side with a measured pull
short, and firmly pulled into the leg-side, in the air a long way but lands safely short of the man at cow corner
that's tremendous bottom-handage... nothing wrong with the yorker, but Buttler finds power from that length that few can rival. And the placement beats the man at cover
power again, this time off the toes, as backward square tries to make up the ground but is well beaten
flicked firmly out to deep square leg, and they somehow turn that into an extra run. England are putting the hammer down
thumped on the up to short cover
well bowled, gets the yorker right into the blockhole, and beats an ambitious wipe. Well bowled Bandara, his first ODI wicket and good reward for perseverence in adversity
width and crunched out to deep point to get off the mark
on the pads, flicked to backward square
on the toes, chiselled out to wide long-on
Root plays his reverse dab again and this time he nails it, a waist-high full-toss, that passes through where first slip might have been standing. No defending that
Lakmal shells a simple catch! 106ks slower ball. Root aims to manufacture his own pace and has a heavo-ho. He can only miscue it in the air. Lakmal runs in from deep midwicket and drops it

Sri Lanka are crashing and burning. Floated full and outside off, possibly a slower ball. The batsman swings and it skews off an outside edge to short third man, Bandara lets it through the legs for four
middle-stump yorker, kept out
good length ball on middle, flashy scoop behind square. Not middled
back of the hand legcutter, Woakes is through with the slog and is beaten
Woakes makes room outside leg, this is pushed down the leg side as the bowler chases him. Picked up and shovelled over fine leg for six, the wind assisting the strike
another slower short ball outside off, slashes early and does not connect
Root got a life in the nineties. Root falls in the nineties. This was the back of the hand legcutter. 112ks. Root dances out and misses the leg-side swipe. Timbaaah!
banged in short and quick on the leg stump, crunched. Pulled strongly off the front foot over backward square leg
short slower ball on the leg stump, Plunkett is caught in a tangle, grazes the elbow and a bit of bat as the ball drills square
back of a length, punched to long-on
Plunkett has nailed that! Back of a length on middle, Plunkett sits deep and waits for the slower ball. Smeared over midwicket

Pradeep collects the ball and pings an over-arm throw, nails the stumps at the non-striker's end. Pradeep hadn't got the yorker right. This is a floaty full toss, which is deflected back to the bowler. The batsmen aim to steal a single off the last ball. The bowler hits now and Plunkett is miles short

inn2.comm: back of a length and swings in a touch to strike the thigh, heading down
overpitched and outside off, bottom-handed shovel to short extra cover
short and wide outside off, Danushka cracks a cut to backward point. Roy dives to his right to make a smart stop. Dot
good length and outside off, pushed with hard hands towards backward point
too full and outside off, Danushka unleashes a powerful drive and finds mid-off
back of a length and angling away outside off, Danushka has a flat-footed swish, and watches the ball whistle past the outside edge
swing right away! Full outswinger outside off, driven to the covers
back of a length and top of off, pushed to short extra cover
short and swinging away outside off, Kusal got on top of the bounce, punching.... but can't beat the packed off-side ring
full and straight, tapped to the off side with a straight bat
short and outside off, looks to pull and loses his shape, drags it over midwicket, not much timing
back of a length, on the hips, tucked away quietly towards square leg
short, at the ribs, pulled round to long leg
length ball, angling across and close to off stump. No footwork there, just pushes at it, looking to hit on the up through cover, and edges thickly to third man
length ball on off stump, they take the quick single after a straight-bat push to mid-off
length ball on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
short, at the body, rises to around chest height, skids on quicker than Perera expected, and he was late on the pull. Top edge loops in the air and drops down safely to the left of fine leg
length ball, swings away gently from a fifth-stump line, left alone
fullish on middle stump, clipped in the air, to the right of the fielder at deep square leg. Vince runs around, and slips just as he's about to field the ball, but no mishaps
back of a length on off stump, punched to short extra cover
full and straight, possibly angling down leg. Kusal looks to whip across the line and misses. Thin inside edge onto the pad, and there's no appeal from Willey
short, angling down leg. Kusal miscues another pull, ends up inside-edging onto his thigh. Nearly loops up for a caught-behind, but drops well short of the advancing Buttler

given by umpire Reiffel! A bit of nip back, looked a touch short for an lbw, on first glance. He was on the back foot, and it hit him quite high on the back leg as he stood there and looked to punch down the ground. Kusal reviews. Replays suggest it wasn't that high. Hits him on the back leg, just above the knee roll, in front of middle stump, and Hawkeye says it's hitting top of the stumps
full on middle, forward and blocked gingerly to mid-off
short and kicks up on off, cramps the batsman, poked towards point via an outside edge
Wokaes induces an outside edge right away. Prodded down to third man as this was full and tight on off
sharp bouncer on the leg stump, beats the hook. The opener was late on the shot
length and outside off, glided behind point
Woakes ventures wide of the crease and angles this full ball in at middle, clipped out to short midwicket
full and sliding into the pads, picked up sweetly over midwicket
back of a length and zeroed in at the top of off, jabbed out to point
back of a length and angled in, dabbed towards backward point
full and straight, flicked in the air, to the left of short midwicket, teases the two chasing fielders. In the end, that's a four, first of SL's chase
banged in short, and cramps the batsman for room. Danushka is pushed back. He takes his eyes off the ball as he flaps a pull over midwicket. Hustling delivery
full and angling away outside off, deliberately run past slip to third man
back of a length on off, dropped defensively in front of point
rising short ball on off, Kusal rides with it and fends it in front of point
short and wide outside off, instead of slashing it away, Kusal chases and misses. Bit of extra lift for Woakes, though the line was wonky
Mendis latches onto this one. Full and outside off, charming bent-knee drive, caressed through the covers
back of a length and angled in at off, guided towards point
length and swings away outside off, draws Mendis forward and passes the outside edge. Fine riposte from the bowler
back of a length and just a shade outside off, steered to backward point with soft hands
back of a length and angled in, nugetty nurdle in front of short midwicket
back of a length on middle, blunted to the leg side
not full enough for the drive outside off, Mendis jabs out in front of short cover
full on off, straight on, Mendis camps back and defends it watchfully
length and leaves Mendis in the channel outside off, the line is closer to off. Mendis had to play. Wafts and misses, as he is dragged forward. Beautiful bowling, this
dug in short and outside off, Danushka frees his arms, clattering a cut, beating Roy flinging to his left at backward point
full on middle, blocked to the off side
straying into the hips, flicked behind square on the leg side
banged in short and outside off, Mendis stands tall and stabs it towards point
angled in full on middle, worked to short midwicket for one
shorter and outside off, Danushka beats Roy again at backward point. Runs a cut to the right of the diving Roy. The opener used the pace of Woakes to his advantage
terrific strike! Full and straight on the off stump, Mendis attacks it, punting it over mid-on for four
good length and angling away, patted into the covers
full at the off stump, blocked to short extra cover
overpitched and outside off, the bat twists in Mendis' hands, as he slices a drive to mid-off. A direct hit from Morgan at the non-striker's end could have made things tighter
back of a length, on and around off, run to backward point
full and outside off, glided towards square-ish point
starts off with a loosener on the pads, clipped only to square leg
shortish and just outside off, cramping the batsman, steered down to third man, although not with comfort
nice change-up. Bumpy short one outside off, Mendis can't upper-cut it away. Boings over to the keeper
full and speared outside off, Mendis does not move his feet much. Reaches out with his hands and stabs a drive to short extra cover
errant short ball down the leg side, tickled down to sub - Moeen Ali - at fine leg
short on off, half-pulled and half-paddled to deep backward square leg
full and largely holds its line outside off, Mendis is caught reaching for the ball with his hands again. Beaten soundly
good length on off, poked towards mid-off
yorker on middle, which is squeezed to short midwicket
this is an off-stump yorker, and it's run down to the third-man boundary. Played, Danushka. Angled that bat and manipulated a four
back of a length and that's bang on off, no room to angle it down to third man. Takes the inside edge and dribbles onto the pitch
good length and outside off, Mendis may have misjudged it. Staying back and chopping to backward point
short and down leg, wide
flayed away to the boundary. Full and outside off, he steps forward and drives it forcefully through the covers
short and outside off, Danushra rides it down to third man
short, rushing ball on off. Mendis pulls, not off the middle. The ball does not carry to deep square leg
length and outside off, guided down to third man
back of a length on middle, twirled to short midwicket
Jordan veers down the leg side, again
short and wide outside off, slashed away over point
short on middle, Mendis hops and clips to square leg
banged in short on middle, Danushka does not flinch. Swivels on the back foot and pulls to long leg
overpitched on off, driven back, Plunkett sticks his leg out and intercepts it

England think they have Mendis, despite the full-stretch dive. Mendis is short on the second, the replays confirm it. Bairstow hands the hosts the breakthrough. Accurate, flat throw to Buttler, who gathers it in front of the stumps and flips the bails off. One stump is sent flying actually. Full and shading towards the leg stump, neatly flicked through midwicket. Bairstow in the deep hunts the ball down. The second was always a risk, especially against Bairstow. Mendis plays the penalty and SL's momentum is snapped
back of a length and zipping through outside off, skirts past the outside edge. Chandimal sticks his bat in the channel and is beaten first up
full and outside off, eased towards point
full and outside off, beaten past the outside edge
short and outside off, leans back and cuts through backward point for two
Danushka takes a step out and whips to the leg side
picks that from the off stump and flicks handsomely through backward square leg
Jordan sprays it miles down leg, wild one
full at the legs, picked away through midwicket
short and width outside off, Danushka flays an uppish cut over point
leg-side ball, ticked through square leg
slides on off, Chandi makes room and cuts to deep point
spinning down the leg side, helped fine to the man in the deep on the leg side
straight short one, Danushka dismisses it. Rocks back and pulls to the left of the square-leg umpire
skiddy one on middle, Danushka drops it in front of his toes
slower turn, takes the pad, but this was heading down leg. Not given. SL want a review. The tracker confirms it was going down. Poor call from Morgan to review it
good length and angled in, turned through midwicket
back of a length on off, dabbed to midwicket

appeal for lbw from round the wicket, umpire Gough's finger goes up. Danushka has a chat with Chandi. But they don't have any reviews. Danushka has to go. This was full and veered in from round the wicket to ping the back leg as Danushka aimed a flick and missed. Was that slipping past leg with the angle?
thumps the thighpad and deflects to the leg side
driven on the up, into the covers
width, and clubbed to short cover, no great timing
big appeal! A lovely loopy line and length from Rashid, who smacks the front pad with the googly, but maybe slightly leg-sided. England wasted their review either way
conventional legbreak, pushing forward
worked into the leg-side
a bit of width - a lot of width, actually - but the cover sweeper is on hand to intercept a flowing cut
back on a tighter line, defended to the bowler
outside off, another calm cut to claim the single
banged in short, a glide down to third man with an upraised bat
defended into the off side
fuller and straighter, hastily defended as it keeps low and attacks the pads
that's a welcome counterattack, short and climbing high but Mathews has no qualms about dragging it down in front of square, and times it well too. Moeen, the sub, can't cut it off at wide long-on
tighter line
driven hard, but only as far as short cover
chiselled out into the leg-side
dragged short, a bona fide long-hop but he gets away with it, a fierce wipe dribbles out to deep midwicket. He  couldn't believe his luck
thumped into the covers
onto the front foot, driving to short cover
driving again, in the air for a few metres but safely wide of cover
tucked into the leg-side
good line, outside off, zipping through to the keeper
driven into the covers, Bairstow makes excellent ground to limit the damage
jabbed back down the pitch, passes very tight to the stumps and they scamper the single
smashed back at the bowler! Plunkett sticks his hands up, partly in self-defence but the ball is through him already. Fierce strike
perfect yorker! That's a fine riposte after being given a centre parting one ball earlier. Fast, full, straight, stump-splattering!
outside off, turning away, guided out to deep cover

tossed up, pitches on the crease as Tharanga drives loosely, and his off stump pops out of the ground with a hugely satisfying "splut"! A first-baller, and now the welsh soprano is beginning to warble
fully forward, smothering the spin, into the off side
on the pads, tucked to leg
forward to defend
pushed to cover, the end of a breakthrough over
Plunkett continues to pound out a beat on an awkward lifting length
lovely strike, slightly over-pitched this time and drummed down the ground, too straight for mid-off to intercept
on the hip, tucked to square leg
outside off, ghosting past the edge, good line
tapped into the covers, well timed from the front foot, but excellently gathered with a tumble
pushed onto the back foot, and a well-judged single to mid-on
looping onto a good length outside off. There's a slip in place as England circle for the kill
a waist-high full toss, and that's a terrible shot! Shocked, no doubt, at the offering, and wellied into no-man's land on the leg-side
solidly forward, better from batsman and bowler
eased into the leg-side
dabbed into the covers
deflected into the leg-side
outside off, wafty drive but too wide to connect
down the leg side and helped on its way. Buttler dives in vain
full length, tucked to midwicket
outside off, through to the keeper
very full, dug out to short midwicket
fended off the hip to midwicket
biff! Lots of air, a gallop to meet the pitch and Shanaka heaves into a massive swipe over long-on!
fuller length, pushed back to defend
full face, pushed to cover with urgency
tossed up again, a full toss, but a rapidly plummeting one. Poked to cover
short and spinning away, slashed hard in the air down to third man
defended on the line of middle stump, good recovery from that spanking hit
pushed to short cover
leg-sided and clipped firmly to the edge of the rope, where Vince pounces excellently to intercept
banged in short. Too short
cracked on the up, out to deep cover
back of a length, a slower ball, and dabbed into the off side
quicker and fuller, hastily defended
slower ball again, much fuller length. Mixing it up well
googly, quick and flat, chopped to backward point
flicks the pad on the way down the leg side, and England are appealing for the stumping... nope, nothing doing there
forward, and driven back to the bowler
looked like another googly, Chandimal certainly worked his shot as if with the spin, out to midwicket
pushed to cover
forward to defend
dragged down the track, beaten by a big legbreak, classical legspinner's wiles and there's no way to get back in time before Buttler whips off the bails!
onto the front foot, pushed into the covers
down the leg-side, on the hip, can't cut that off ...
short and a bit wild
deep in the crease, nudged into the off side to get off the mark
tapped into the covers
up on the toes, pushed out to point
short and leg-sided again but brushes Prasanna's gloves
hoisted into the leg side
tossed up and dabbed to cover
attempted sweep from outside off, but the ball lodges in the midriff
googly, well disguised and jabbed out to point off the back foot
slow legbreak, all the pace taken off that time, and slap-batted into the covers, as if trying to put the pace straight back on again
loopy line and length, tapped to the off side
very full, driven back past the bowler
forward and defended out to third man
outside off and lifting off the seam, well bowled, well beaten
on the pads, tucked to midwicket
much fuller, and a huge appeal from Jordan as this one strikes Prasanna on the pad. But with no reviews left Jordan will have to accept that that was slightly leg-sided ... which it was
slower ball, through to the keeper
solidly forward and blocked
worked down to deep backward square, and Bairstow fumbles! The horror!
crashed off the back foot into the off side
full and probing
chopped to point
forward, into the off side, Rashid's economical offerings continue
on the pads, sliding down the leg side
lifting from a full length, met with an angled defence to short midwicket
banged in shorter, and an exuberant pull out to deep midwicket. Good aggression, but Sri Lanka are sinking fast
into the toes, dug out to the covers
leg-sided once again, deflected to fine leg
slower bouncer to complete the over
outside off, tapped to cover
down on one knee for a premeditated sweep, but no contact
poked to point
on the back foot, crunched out to deep cover
line and length, loop and flight
forward and stabbed down the track, that's the end of a fine set from Rashid.
Chandi steps out, this is a sharp rising ball on middle, Chandi hooks and sends a top edge over third man for six. Goes all the way!
Chandi takes a step out again, this time the length isn't too short, dispatched over midwicket
slower full toss, whipped past midwicket

Prasanna pulls and hits it reasonably well. The placement, though, was wrong. Excellent catch at fine leg. Willey dives forward to snap up a low catch. This was short on the leg stump and the fielder came out with the ball in his left hand
nasty bouncer from Plunkett, fended awkwardly behind square as Lakmal took his eyes off the ball
full and veering into the pads, diverted to the keeper
pitched up and outside off, Chandi comes forward and drills a drive to short extra cover
too full and outside off, mis-times a drive to mid-off, Willey fumbles a bit, making life easier for Chandi
full on off, defended
full at off, driven straight to mid-off
misdirects a short ball down leg, wide
back of a length and outside off, punched to mid-off
there comes the short ball, on off, not as vicious as the Plunkett lifter. Blunted onto the pitch after hopping and skipping
Chandi dances out and flicks this full ball from middle to long-on
full and angling away, helped down to third man
yorker at the leg stump, jammed to the midwicket region
full and angled in on off from round the wicket, played back to the bowler
yorker, veers in on off from round the wicket, dug back
full and straight, not quite a yorker, clipped out to short fine leg
back of a length and angled in, turned through backward square for a couple. Good intent from Chandi
width and Chandi cracks it to short extra cover, where the fielder feels the heat. Half-save
length and outside off, Lakmal clears his front leg. Has a good ol' slog.... and misses
short and nibbling away outside off, Lakmal has a waft and is beaten past the outside edge
good length on off, blocked back to Woakes
back of a length and holds its line on off, Lakmal has to settle with a poked single to third man
full and angled in on off from round the stumps, whipped to long-on
full and veers in, flicked to deep midwicket
full and angled on middle and off, clipped to long-on, again
full and holds its line outside off, Chandi targets a smear over cover and ends up thick-edging a single to third man. Another fighting fifty for Chandi
full and outside off, Chandi reaches out for a drive and only connects with thin air
Lakmal saunters down the track, meets a length ball, and blasts it to the left of Willey, who was taking evasive action, for four
fullish and wide outside off, Chandi throws his hands at a roundhouse leg-side swipe. No dice
seemed like a cutter outside off, forced to mid-off
back of a length and swerves in, raps the pad, after taking the inside edge
back of a length outside off, worked to mid-on
errant ball down the leg side
full and outside off, Lakmal is caught on a fishing expedition in the channel. Woakes defeats the outside edge
full and outside off, another one flashes past the outside edge
back of a length on leg from over the wicket, Chandi surges down the track and heaves to deep midwicket
tucked to the leg side
yorker, squeezed to sweeper cover

Lakmal plops a catch into the hands of Morgan at short extra cover. Cutter from Willey, sticks in the surface, outside off. Lakmal loses his shape as he seeks to drive. He has to settle with a sliced hit to the England captain
full at the legs from round the wicket, Pradeep whips to deep midwicket

knocked em' over. Back of a length and swings away from Chandimal from over the wicket. Is the ball reversing? Chandi pushes with a straight bat and misses. Willey strikes the top of middle. SL nine down
low full toss on middle, Pradeep backs away and flat-bat biffs to the cover fence
Pradeep jumps outside leg again, Woakes replies with a bouncer chasing the moving batsman. Beaten on the hook
Pradeep shuffles outside leg for the third time in a row. Woakes follows him, instead of targetting the stumps
full on middle, Pradeep backs away outside leg and scythes it to the right of Roy at backward point. Perhaps, Roy did not pick it up. He was late to react
full at middle, Pradeep stays in the crease and taps down the ground
loopy slower short ball, 67mph. The batsman is fooled and is pinged on the elbow
floated full on off, pushed down to mid-off
full and reverse-swings in, inside-edged to the leg side as the No.11 wafts at the incoming ball
length and holds its line outside off, Bandara gets his first runs via an flashing outside edge to third man
England wrap up a 3-0 series win. Full at the leg stump, hint of reverse-swing again, Pradeep backs away and searches for a lofted hit. He can only miscue it to mid-on. Woakes settles under it
